div1.p: Russell quotes from a letter written by Dr. Andrew Balfour that compares Henry Rose Carter to Sir Patrick Manson and describes Carter as a pioneer in his field.

April 7, 1926.
My dear Miss Carter:
div1.p:
There is a paragraph in a letter from
Dr. Andrew Balfour to Mr. Williamson dated October
21, 1925, referring to your father which I think
you will be glad to have. It is as follows:

“I was sorry to see that Dr.
Henry Rose Carter had passed
away. He was a very remark-
able man and greatly reminded
me of Sir Patrick Manson. He
had the same fine scientific
imagination tempered by sound
common sense. I recall with
great pleasure the talk I had
with him about yellow fever and
I managed to get a lantern slide
of his portrait prepared and
included it in my pioneer series.
Dr. Hanson was present at the
address and was very glad to
hear the reference to Dr. Carter
and his work and also to see the
portraits of Nott & King which
I owe to your kindness.”
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, F. F. Russell Miss Laura A. Carter
2121 California Street, N.W.
Washington, D. C.
